verses.roman:
yady asatyaṁ vacaḥ śambhoḥ
kathañcid dānavarṣabha
tadainaṁ jahy asad-vācaṁ
na yad vaktānṛtaṁ punaḥ

synonyms: yadi—if; asatyam—untrue; vacaḥ—the words; śambhoḥ—of Lord Śiva; kathañcit—in any way; dānava-ṛṣabha—O best of the demons; tadā—then; enam—him; jahi—please kill; asat—untrue; vācam—whose words; na—not; yat—so that; vaktā—he may speak; anṛtam—what is false; punaḥ—again.
translation: If the words of Lord Śambhu prove untrue in any way, O best of the demons, then kill the liar so he may never lie again.

purport.content: Lord Śiva may have the power to revive himself even after being killed, but at least he will be dissuaded from lying again.
